title: What are some common paradoxes that most people experience? - Quora

response.answer_text: Life itself can be considered a paradox so we can start with that. Breaking it down a little, these come to mind. we are born to die2. learning by experience ( sometimes a very painful way of learning ) 3. the possible wisdom that comes with growing old ( often too late to enjoy fully ) 4. having to obtain a degree to perform work that often has nothing to do with the degree 5. obtaining what one wants and feeling miserable The last 3 are a variation of learning by experience so I will stop here. Check out Paradox Of Our Time -- George Carlin One more…the possible paradox that the same intelligence that has created our technologies can also lead to our obsolescence.

No one experiences paradoxes in reality, common or otherwise. Every so-called paradox is a matter of someone mis-perceiving reality—which does not contradict itself. Some people like to deliberately create paradoxes by saying things that are cleverly absurd—as mere word games—or as a show of intellect.  Notice: paradox : something (such as a situation) that is made up of two opposite things and that seems impossible but is actually true or possible : someone who does two things that seem to be opposite to each other or who has qualities that are opposite : a statement that seems to say two opposite things but that may be true Source: merriam-webster.com In every case, the “paradox” occurs in the observer’s mind—the contradiction is a matter of limited or inaccurate perception. That’s all it is, folks. Nothing to get excited about.
